message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.ST, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating functionals of discrete distributions, specifically the Shannon entropy and power moments, using the maximum likelihood estimator (MLE) and the plug-in rule. This involves analyzing the bias and variance of the estimator, and characterizing its maximum $L_2$ risk. The techniques used involve concentration inequalities, approximation using positive linear operators, and sample complexity analysis. These topics are relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), statistics (cs.ST), and signal processing (cs.SI).
